channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report X-2024021019
item.description:
Report X-2024021019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021019 SequenceEvent: Package was found with the bottom of the box wet while loading. Upon inspection There are 4 1-gallon bottles inside of the box in a plastic bag, 3 of which looked like they had leaked from the cap. At some point during transit, the package could have been put on its side or upside down, not following the direction of the orientation arrows. No other cracks or holes were found that would result in contents leaking. Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing. DescribePack: All bottles still had the caps on them but still resulted in them leaking. No other defects were found. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing. 2. X-2024021026 SequenceEvent: Package was found with the bottom of the box wet while loading. Upon inspection there are 4 1-gallon bottles inside of the box in a plastic bag, 1 of which was leaking from the cap when put upside down or on its side. Package at some point during transit was most likely put on its side resulting in contents leaking. Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap resulting in it leaking contents when put on its side or upside down. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote and taken to a designated QA area for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024021125
item.description:
Report X-2024021125

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: LOOSE CAP LEAKING NON-FLAMMABLE LIQUID, ULOADED, PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: 1 LOOSE CAP OF NON-FLAMMABLE LIQUID, BD HEMATOXYLIN STAIN 0.75 INSIDE A CYTOLOGY STAIN KIT WITH UNDAMAGED FLAMMABLE LIQUID BD EA/OG COMBO STAIN LEAKED ENTIRE CONTENT SOILING THE WET TORN HAZMAT BOX AND ALL CONTENTS INSIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A HAZMAT BAG AND RED HAZMAT TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2024021013
item.description:
Report X-2024021013

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: NORTH SALT LAKE
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found with one end opened. Upon inspection there are two bottles inside, one of them had a broken lid and the other lid was secure but you could still see where some of the contents had leaked out. This was most likely caused by not following the orientation arrows and package being dropped. The package was put in a red hazmat tote and brought over to the QA area for processing. DescribePack: One of the lids was cracked in half and broken. The other lid looked secure but still showed signs of leaking some of it's contents. Neither bottle had a seal under the lid. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was put in a red hazmat tote and brought to a designated QA area for processing.

item.title: Report E-2024020345
item.description:
Report E-2024020345

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: WEST VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 8, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1993 were punctured by a nail in transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel personnel placed the one damaged pails into an 85-gallon over-pack for terminal disposal. The second dented pail was placed back on the pallet due to no leakage.
